Introduction
Guidance overview and application

This Guidance provides information about the obligations of ADGM limited companies concerning the ESG Disclosures Framework.
Legal framework

The relevant ADGM legislation regarding accounts for limited companies is the CR.

The ADGM’s Regulations and Rules are available on the ADGM website by following this link (https://en.adgm.thomsonreuters.com/).
Important information

The RA cannot give technical or legal advice, it can only give general guidance. Questions concerning a specific company which arise following a review of this Guidance should be directed to appropriately skilled legal or accounting professionals.

   - Familiarize yourself with the ADGM Companies Regulations (CR) and ESG Disclosures Framework.
   - Regularly review updates to ADGM Regulations and Rules on the ADGM website."

Obligation:2 "Understand ESG Disclosure Requirements**:

   - Keep accurate and comprehensive records of ESG disclosures and related documents."

Obligation:7 "Ensure Transparency and Accountability**:

Obligation:8 "Stay Informed and Responsive**:

Purpose of the ESG Disclosures Framework

The RA’s ESG Disclosures Framework seeks to encourage good practice by ADGM companies in disclosing applicable information on ESG factors in line with a globally recognised disclosures standard.

The ESG Disclosures Framework may be applied by all ADGM entities on a voluntary basis.  For in-scope ADGM companies – being ADGM companies meeting one or more of the Threshold Conditions - the RA has adopted a flexible ‘comply or explain’ approach to applicable disclosures.  In doing so, ADGM wishes to foster an ecosystem of companies which seek to help play a part in meeting the UAE’s net zero by 2050 strategic initiative by disclosing the impact of their company’s operations on ESG factors.

The RA will monitor whether the ‘comply or explain’ approach is effective in achieving the stated outcomes of the ESG Disclosures Framework.  In the future, the RA may decide to impose a mandatory ESG disclosures framework for in-scope entities. Nothing in this Guidance should be interpreted as an assurance that the ‘comply or explain’ approach will continue in the future.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Assess In-Scope Status**: Determine if your company meets the Threshold Conditions to be classified as an in-scope entity under the ADGM's ESG Disclosures Framework."

Obligation:2 "Disclosure of ESG Information**: If in-scope, disclose relevant ESG information in accordance with a globally recognized disclosure standard or provide a reasoned explanation if you choose not to disclose."

Obligation:3 "Adopt Comply or Explain Approach**: For in-scope companies, decide whether to:
   - **Comply**: Prepare and publish ESG disclosures as per the framework's guidelines.
   - **Explain**: Provide a transparent explanation detailing the reasons for not disclosing certain ESG information."
Obligation:4 "Contribute to UAE’s Strategic Initiative**: Participate in the UAE’s net zero by 2050 strategic initiative by disclosing ESG impacts, if applicable."

Obligation:5 "Monitor Regulatory Changes**: Stay informed about the ADGM RA's monitoring activities and be prepared for potential changes to the ESG Disclosures Framework, including the possibility of mandatory disclosures in the future."
Obligation:6 "Prepare for Future Requirements**: Understand that the 'comply or explain' approach may not be permanent and anticipate potential mandatory ESG disclosure requirements."
Obligation:7 "Voluntary Adoption**: If not in-scope, consider voluntarily adopting the ESG Disclosures Framework to enhance your company's reputation and commitment to sustainability."
Obligation:8 "Stay Informed**: Regularly review updates to the ESG Disclosures Framework and any changes in the Threshold Conditions to ensure ongoing compliance."

Scope of the ESG Disclosures Framework

Companies established in or continued into ADGM may be within the scope of the ESG Disclosures Framework.  The following entities do not fall within the scope of the ESG Disclosures Framework, either by virtue of not being governed by the CR, or by being expressly exempted from the scope of the ESG Disclosures Framework.
a.	Foundations.
b.	Limited Liability Partnerships.
c.	General and Limited Partnerships.
d.	Restricted Scope Companies.
e.	Publicly listed companies that already make equivalent disclosures in accordance with listing requirements.  For the avoidance of doubt, entities considered ‘Listed Entities’ or ‘Reporting Entities’ for the purposes of the FSRA’s MKT Rulebook remain subject to the ESG disclosures requirements set out therein.
f.	Investment Companies.
g.	Branches of foreign companies.

However, the ESG Disclosures Framework may be applied by all ADGM entities on a voluntary basis.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Determine Company Scope**: Assess whether your company falls within the exempt categories of the ADGM ESG Disclosures Framework:
   - Foundations
   - Limited Liability Partnerships
   - General and Limited Partnerships
   - Restricted Scope Companies
   - Publicly listed companies with equivalent disclosures
   - Investment Companies
   - Branches of foreign companies"
Obligation:2 "ESG Disclosures**: If not exempt, prepare and disclose ESG information as per the ADGM requirements."
Obligation:3 "Compliance with Framework Requirements**: Ensure that your ESG disclosures are in line with the ADGM ESG Disclosures Framework's guidelines."
Obligation:4 "Record-Keeping**: Maintain accurate records supporting your ESG disclosures for verification and compliance demonstration."
Obligation:5 "Transparency**: Provide clear and understandable ESG disclosures to stakeholders."
Obligation:6 "Regular Updates**: Update your ESG disclosures regularly according to the framework's requirements."
Obligation:7 "Monitoring and Review**: Establish processes for monitoring and reviewing ESG activities and disclosure effectiveness."
Obligation:8 "Voluntary Application**: If exempt, consider voluntary compliance with the ESG Disclosures Framework."
Obligation:9 "Review Specific Provisions**: Examine the ADGM's ESG Disclosures Framework for full compliance requirements."
Obligation:10 "Implement Reporting Mechanisms**: If applicable, set up appropriate mechanisms for ESG reporting."

Obligation:11 "Listed or Reporting Entities**: If your company is a 'Listed Entity' or 'Reporting Entity' as per the FSRA’s MKT Rulebook, comply with the ESG disclosures requirements regardless of other exemptions."

Time to comply

A company incorporated in or continued into ADGM will be required to comply with the ESG Disclosures Framework in the third year following its incorporation or continuance if it satisfies the Threshold Conditions.  The three-year grace period applies from the date of incorporation or continuance as opposed to the date of amendment of the CR to include the ESG Disclosures Framework. This means an existing company may be required to comply in 2023.

Obligation:2 "Understand the Framework**: Familiarize yourself with the ESG Disclosures Framework to grasp the disclosure requirements, including environmental, social, and governance information, disclosure formats, and compliance standards."
Obligation:3 "Prepare for Compliance**: Set up internal processes for data collection, analysis, and reporting, and consider engaging external consultants or auditors if necessary."
Obligation:4 "Implement ESG Practices**: Integrate necessary ESG practices into your company's operations to ensure accurate and reflective disclosures of your ESG performance."
Obligation:5 "Disclosure and Reporting**: Compile and present ESG disclosures in accordance with the ADGM's framework guidelines, ensuring completeness and accuracy."

Obligation:7 "Monitor Regulatory Changes**: Stay updated on any changes to the ESG Disclosures Framework and adjust your company's practices and disclosures as needed."

Threshold conditions

A company incorporated in or continued into ADGM will be required to comply with the ESG Disclosures Framework if it satisfies the Threshold Conditions, being either a ‘turnover’ threshold or an ‘AUM’ threshold.

The turnover threshold is reached when a company achieves more than US$ 68 million turnover in a financial year.  The AUM threshold only applies to FSRA-licensed asset management companies which manage funds and/or portfolios with an aggregate value exceeding US$ 6 billion at any time during such financial year.

The ESG Disclosures Framework does not apply to companies who no longer meet the threshold conditions for two consecutive years or more.  Should the company subsequently meet the threshold conditions in a given year, the ESG Disclosures Framework will once again apply.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Determine if your company meets the ESG Disclosures Framework thresholds:
   - Check if the company's turnover exceeds US$ 68 million in a financial year.
   - Check if the company, as an FSRA-licensed asset management firm, manages funds or portfolios exceeding US$ 6 billion at any point in a financial year."

Obligation:2 "Prepare and disclose ESG information:
   - Compile an ESG report detailing the company's environmental impact, social practices, and governance structures.
   - Ensure ESG disclosures are accurate, comprehensive, clear, and understandable.
   - Follow the ESG Disclosures Framework's specific reporting standards or guidelines."

Obligation:3 "Make ESG disclosures publicly available:
   - Publish ESG disclosures on the company's website or in its annual report."

Obligation:4 "Maintain records:
   - Keep documentation that supports the ESG disclosures made."

Obligation:5 "Submit ESG disclosures to authorities:
   - Provide the required ESG disclosures to the relevant ADGM authorities within the stipulated timeframes."

Obligation:6 "Monitor compliance status:
   - If the company does not meet the thresholds for two consecutive years, note the exemption from the ESG Disclosures Framework.
   - If the company subsequently meets the thresholds after a period of exemption, resume compliance with the ESG Disclosures Framework."

Obligation:7 "Report to stakeholders:
   - Communicate ESG information to stakeholders as required by the framework."

Obligation:8 "Consult with legal or regulatory advisors:
   - For a complete understanding of obligations, refer to the actual ESG Disclosures Framework and consider seeking legal advice or consulting with the FSRA."

Disclosures standard

A company which is required to prepare and submit ESG disclosures must prepare its submissions consistent with a standard which is globally recognised in the reasonable opinion of the company’s directors.  The following is a non-exhaustive list of examples of globally recognised standards:

•	Carbon Disclosure Project (CDP)
•	Global Reporting Initiative (GRI)
•	Higg Index
•	International Sustainability Standards Board (ISSB)
•	Task Force on ESG Financial Disclosures (TCFD)
•	United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (UNSDG)

A company may change the applicable disclosures standard at its discretion.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Select a Globally Recognized Standard**: Choose an ESG disclosure standard that is globally recognized. The board of directors must determine what constitutes such a standard."
Obligation:2 "Ensure Consistency with the Chosen Standard**: Align your ESG disclosures with the principles, metrics, and guidelines of the selected standard."

Obligation:3 "Consider Listed Standards**: Review the provided list of globally recognized standards (e.g., CDP, GRI, Higg Index, ISSB, TCFD, UNSDG) and select the most appropriate one for your company."
Obligation:4 "Maintain Flexibility to Change Standards**: Be aware that you can change the ESG disclosure standard if necessary, but consider the implications on comparability and stakeholder trust."

Obligation:5 "Document and Keep Records**: Document the rationale for selecting a particular standard and any changes made. Maintain records of how disclosures were prepared, including assumptions and methodologies."
Obligation:6 "Submit ESG Disclosures Timely**: Submit your ESG disclosures as required by the regulatory framework within the ADGM, adhering to any specified deadlines and guidelines."
Obligation:7 "Review and Update Policies Regularly**: Continuously review and update your ESG disclosure policies and procedures to comply with the chosen standard and regulatory changes."
Obligation:8 "Board Oversight**: Ensure that the board of directors oversees the ESG disclosure process, verifying that disclosures accurately represent the company's ESG performance."
Obligation:9 "Engage with Stakeholders**: Communicate with stakeholders to ensure that the ESG disclosures meet their information needs and expectations."
Obligation:10 "Monitor for Compliance**: Keep abreast of updates or changes to the chosen standard to ensure that your company's disclosures remain compliant."

Obligation:11 "Seek Further Guidance**: If there are uncertainties regarding the application of these standards, consider seeking further guidance or legal advice.

Note: The action items are derived from the provided responses and are intended to guide companies in fulfilling their obligations related to ESG disclosures. It is important to consult the full regulatory texts or seek professional advice for comprehensive compliance."

Non-submission of ESG disclosures by in-scope companies

The ESG Disclosures Framework offers flexibility through its ‘comply or explain’ approach, which is designed to encourage companies to develop governance processes and practices that are the most suitable for their particular circumstances and to report them in a meaningful way.

While the Registrar expects all in-scope companies to submit ESG disclosures, it is acknowledged that it may take time for such companies to develop necessary systems and controls.  The Registrar encourages companies to embrace the flexibility offered by the ESG Disclosures Framework, consider their circumstances carefully and choose what is best for them, while clearly explaining any determination not to make ESG disclosures.

When informing the Registrar of its decision not to submit ESG disclosures in accordance with subsection 399B(5) of the CR, a company should submit correspondence to monitoring@adgm.com, including a description of the reasons for its determination.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Assess Company Scope**: Determine whether your company is within the scope of entities required to make ESG disclosures under ADGM regulations."
Obligation:2 "Develop Governance Processes**: Establish governance processes and practices for ESG that are appropriate for your company's specific circumstances."

Obligation:3 "Make ESG Disclosures or Provide Explanation**: Choose to either:
   - Submit ESG disclosures in accordance with the framework's requirements.
   - Provide a clear and detailed explanation if ESG disclosures are not suitable for your company at this time."

Obligation:4 "Communicate Non-disclosure to the Registrar**: If not disclosing ESG information:
   - Inform the Registrar of the decision not to make ESG disclosures.
   - Include a detailed explanation of the reasons for non-disclosure.
   - Reference subsection 399B(5) of the Companies Regulations (CR) in your correspondence.
   - Send the correspondence to the designated email address: monitoring@adgm.com."
Obligation:5 "Monitor Regulatory Updates**: Keep abreast of any changes to the ESG Disclosures Framework and update your company's practices as necessary."

Obligation:6 "Record-Keeping**: Maintain documentation of your governance processes, practices, and any communications with the Registrar regarding ESG disclosures or explanations for non-disclosure."

Obligation:7 "Engage with the Registrar**: Be ready to interact with the Registrar for any follow-up queries or requests for additional information about your ESG disclosures or explanations for non-disclosure."

Obligation:8 "Develop Systems and Controls**: If necessary, work on establishing the systems and controls required to make ESG disclosures, understanding that this may be a gradual process.

Remember that the 'comply or explain' approach requires a balance between flexibility, transparency, and accountability. Make informed decisions and ensure that any explanations for non-disclosure are thorough and justifiable. Stay compliant with ADGM regulations and maintain open communication with the Registrar."

The Registration Authority can only give general guidance. A company’s accounts are subject to legal requirements, and a company may wish to consider consulting a professional if technical or legal advice is required.
This Guidance is a non-binding indicative guide and should be read together with the relevant legislation, in particular the CR and any other relevant regulations and enabling rules, which may change over time without notice.  Information in this Guidance is not to be deemed, considered or relied upon as legal advice and should not be treated as a substitute for a specific advice concerning any individual situation.  Any action taken upon the information provided in this Guidance is strictly at the company’s risk and the Registration Authority will not be liable for any losses and damages in connection with the use of or reliance on information provided in this Guidance. The Registration Authority makes no representations as to the accuracy, completeness, correctness or suitability of any information provided in this Guidance.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Ensure Compliance with Legal Requirements**: Maintain accounts in accordance with the legal requirements applicable within the ADGM, including the Companies Regulations (CR) and any other relevant regulations and enabling rules."
Obligation:2 "Seek Professional Advice**: Consult with professional advisors for technical or legal assistance with company accounts to ensure specific compliance."
Obligation:3 "Conduct Due Diligence**: Perform due diligence to ensure actions taken based on general guidance are in compliance with relevant legislation."
Obligation:4 "Stay Informed of Regulatory Changes**: Regularly review regulations and stay updated on any changes to ensure ongoing compliance."
Obligation:5 "Manage Risks**: Assume responsibility for risks associated with compliance and reliance on general guidance provided by the Registration Authority."

Obligation:6 "Verify Information**: Do not rely solely on the guidance for accuracy, completeness, or suitability; verify information and ensure it is appropriate for the company's specific situation."
Obligation:7 "Maintain Accurate Records**: Keep accurate and complete records of financial transactions to support compliance with legal requirements."
Obligation:8 "Complete Reporting Requirements**: Accurately complete and submit required financial reporting or disclosures within stipulated deadlines."
Obligation:9 "Assume Responsibility**: Take ultimate responsibility for ensuring the company operates in compliance with ADGM financial regulations and any other applicable laws."
